intro: Sanguisorba formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan sorrel, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, with clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Sanguisorba formosana is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, woodland environments.
